titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 22: Trattato di varie cose attenenti a guerra, molini, aque, pesi, mechaniche fortezze, et altro

notesStmt.note: Title from title page (p. i); spine title Trattato di coses attenenti a guerra.

msContents.summary: Illustrated treatise in 4 books on machinery, addressing machines for attacking fortified cities, the use of waterwheels in mills and manufacturing, and the construction of defensive fortifications, followed by an alphabetical index. Some oxidation, especially along heavy lines.

msItem.title: Trattato di varie cose attenenti a guerra, molini, aque, pesi, mechaniche fortezze, et altro

supportDesc.extent: 99 leaves : 305 x 215 (260 x 158) mm. bound to 311 x 230 mm

collation.p: Paper, i + 99 + i; 1¹⁶(+1) 2-5¹⁶ 6¹⁸; [i-ii, 1], 2-191, [192-196], contemporary pagination in ink, upper outer corners.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 35-36 lines; ruled in lead, vertical bounding lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: Numerous technical drawings in ink; decorative initials in ink, 3 to 5 lines in height, at the beginning of each chapter.

binding.p: Contemporary (late 17th-century) parchment over paper boards, with title Trattato di coses att[enent]i a guerra M.S. in ink on spine.

origin.p: Written in Italy in 1687 (p. i (title page), 179 ).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Frederick North, fifth Earl of Guilford.
Sold at auction by R. H. Evans as part of the North collection, 8-11 Dec. 1830, second volume of lot 262 (number on spine in ink), to John Cochran.
Formerly owned by Sir Thomas Phillipps, ms. 5473.
Sold at auction at Swann Galleries, 6 Dec. 1984, lot 200, to Lawrence J. Schoenberg.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2012.

keywords.term: Military art and science--Early works to 1800
